ARABIC: أَطَّلَعَ ٱلْغَيْبَ أَمِ ٱتَّخَذَ عِندَ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ عَهْدًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Has he surveyed the Unseen or has he a contract with the All-Merciful?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Has he peeped into the Unknown, or obtained a promise from Ar-Rahman?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Has he obtained knowledge of the Unseen, or has he taken a covenant with the Most Compassionate Lord?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Has he the knowledge of the unseen or has the Beneficent God established such a binding agreement with Him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Has he seen the Hidden, or has he made a pact with the Most Gracious?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Has he known the Unseen or has he taken a covenant from the Most Gracious
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Has he gained knowledge of the unseen, or made a covenant with the Beneficent Allah?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: What, has he observed the Unseen, or taken a covenant with the All-merciful?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Hath he perused the Unseen, or hath he made a pact with the Beneficent?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Has he looked to the unseen, or has he made a pledge to the Merciful One?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Hath he looked unto the Unseen, or hath he taken of the Compassionate a covenant? *Chapter: 19
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Has he come to know the Unseen, or taken a promise from the All-beneficent?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Has he penetrated to the Unseen, or has he taken a contract with (Allah) Most Gracious?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Has he known the unseen or has he taken a covenant from the Most Beneficent (Allah)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Has he gained knowledge of the Unseen? Or taken a covenant with the Merciful?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Did he look into the future, or did he receive a promise from the Most Merciful?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Has he looked into the unseen, or has he taken from the Most Merciful a promise?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [19:78] Has he come to learn [something] of the Unseen, that is, has he been given [some] knowledge of it and [of the fact] that he will be given what he has mentioned (here the interrogative hamza [of a-ittala‘a, ‘has he come to learn?’] suffices in place of the conjunctive hamza, which has therefore been omitted) or has he made a covenant with the Compassionate One?, to [the effect that he] be given what he claims?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: But Allah answered him, saying: (Hath he perused the Unseen) did he have a look at the Guarded Tablet for him to claim what he claimed, (or hath he made a pact with the Beneficent) by means of 'there is no deity except Allah' such that he can claim this claim?
